titleStmt.title: Partial Manuscripts Schema, constrained for usage in XForms
titleStmt.author: Maximilian de Molière
Nathan Gibson
Maximilian de Molière

publicationStmt.authority: Institut für den Nahen und Mittleren Osten
publicationStmt.publisher: ERC-funded project: MAJLIS. The Transformation of Jewish Literature in Arabic in the Islamicate World

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

revisionDesc.change: Created schema on basis of Arabic Manuscripts Schema created by Pietro Liuzzo

div.head: Information on this customization
div.p: Schema for MAJLIS Project. This part of the schema is used for entering descriptions of the manuscript support using XForms.
Built on the Beta maṣāḥǝft Guidelines contain examples and details of that customization.
Added Rules from the consolidated schema of FIRHIST
Constrained this schema for generating forms.

moduleRef.except: list abbr add addrLine address analytic biblScope biblStruct binaryObject cb choice cit corr del distinct divGen editor ellipsis email emph expan foreign gap gb gloss graphic head headItem headLabel hi imprint index item l label lb lg listBibl measure measureGrp media meeting mentioned milestone monogr name noteGrp num orig pb postBox postCode pubPlace publisher quote rb reg relatedItem resp respStmt rs rt ruby said series sic soCalled sp speaker stage street teiCorpus term time unclear unit author note p q ref textLang title

moduleRef.include: persName listPerson person addName forename birth placeName death floruit sex faith occupation residence

elementSpec.desc: You can either create child elements for every component like ism, kunya, etc. OR you enter the full form into the field.
Name elements like kunya or patronym that do not fit the mold of forenames and surnames. Choose the type of name from the attribute list.
The full form of a person's name.
A bibliographic item, like a monograph, journal article, or manuscript.
Provide the date and place of birth in the respective child elements.
Fill in the date in the agreed-upon calendrical system. Use the "when" attribute for precise values. In case the date can only be approximated, use the "notAfter "and "notBefore" attributes together.
Provide the date and place of death in the respective child elements.
Specify the religion of the person.

Specify the period of intellectual activity. Fill in the date in the agreed-upon calendrical system. Use the "when" attribute for precise values. In case the date can only be approximated, use the "notAfter "and "notBefore" attributes together.
Describe the person's profession. This is NOT the role the person played with regard to the manuscripts.

Look up the place records in the database to specify a settlement or town. Try different spellings in different languages! If no suitable record exists, create a new one. (The "ref" attribute will be filled out automatically when you link a place record to this element.)
Specify the relationship between the person and another person or object. Choose the kind of relation from the list provided in the "name" attributea and add the URIs of the respective records.

valItem.desc: @active: Work, @passive: Person. http://purl.org/saws/ontology#isAttributedToAuthor Beta maṣāḥǝft SPARQL query for examples.
@active: Work, @passive: Person. http://purl.org/dc/terms/creator Beta maṣāḥǝft SPARQL query for examples.
@active: Work, @passive: Person. definition in syriaca.org Beta maṣāḥǝft SPARQL query for examples.
@active: Person, @passive: Person. Is the wife of ... Beta maṣāḥǝft SPARQL query for examples.
@active: Person, @passive: Person. Is the husband of.. Beta maṣāḥǝft SPARQL query for examples.
@active: Person, @passive: Person. Is the mother of the legally conjugated partner. Beta maṣāḥǝft SPARQL query for examples.
@active: Person, @passive: Person. Is the father of the legally conjugated partner. Beta maṣāḥǝft SPARQL query for examples.

@active: Person, @passive: Person. Is the wife of the son. Beta maṣāḥǝft SPARQL query for examples.

@active: Person, @passive: Manuscript. If you can, edit the manuscript record with persName[@role='owner'] instead. http://purl.org/saws/ontology#hasOwned Beta maṣāḥǝft SPARQL query for examples.
@active: Person, @passive: Manuscript. If you can, edit the manuscript record with persName[@role='scribe'] instead. http://purl.org/saws/ontology#isCopierOf Beta maṣāḥǝft SPARQL query for examples.
@active: Person, @passive: Manuscript Part. This is used to state the authorship of a marginal note for example. http://purl.org/saws/ontology#hasWritten Beta maṣāḥǝft SPARQL query for examples.
@active: Person, @passive: Work. http://erlangen-crm.org/current/P129i_is_subject_of Beta maṣāḥǝft SPARQL query for examples.
@active: Person, @passive: Work. http://purl.org/saws/ontology#isAttributedAuthorOf Beta maṣāḥǝft SPARQL query for examples.
@active: Place, @passive: Place. definition in syriaca.org Beta maṣāḥǝft SPARQL query for examples.
@active: Person, @passive: Place. definition in syriaca.org Beta maṣāḥǝft SPARQL query for examples.
@active: Person, @passive: Place. definition in syriaca.org Beta maṣāḥǝft SPARQL query for examples.
